summary: This document is an email chain from September 2019 involving attorney Jack Scarola forwarding allegations from a victim (referred to as 'UM-') to federal prosecutors. It contains a memo detailing a victim's account of being forced to translate for Jeffrey Epstein in 1996 and witnessing 30 Middle Eastern girls held as sex slaves. The correspondence also discusses arranging a meeting between prosecutors and another victim who received gifts from Epstein.

events.title: Alleged Forced Translation and Witnessing of Sex Slaves
events.description: A 15-year-old victim was allegedly asked by a priest to meet Jeffrey Epstein to translate for 30 Middle Eastern girls who spoke no English. The victim stated the girls were held in a basement, promised jobs, but were sex slaves. The victim was forced to have sex with men, was on heroin, and later escaped.

keyFacts: A victim alleged that in 1996, Jeffrey Epstein had 30 girls from the Middle East who spoke no English held as sex slaves in California and Florida.
The victim, then 15, was allegedly forced to translate and have sex with men, was on heroin, and escaped by stealing a wallet and jumping out a window.
Epstein allegedly sent a bodyguard to the victim's house in Michigan to threaten to kill him if he told anyone about the girls.
Attorney Jack Scarola provided federal prosecutors with contact information for victim UM-, who was molested by Epstein beginning at age 14 and received gifts of lingerie from him.
The document shows ongoing communication in 2019 between victim attorneys and federal prosecutors (Southern District of New York) regarding witness cooperation in the Epstein investigation.
